thread.title: Tourists rescued from Spain's highest peak after cable car malfunction
thread.title_full: Tourists rescued from Spain's highest peak after cable car malfunction

author: Associated Press in Madrid
title: Tourists rescued from Spain's highest peak after cable car malfunction
text:
Spain Tourists airlifted from Spain's highest peak after cable car fails 
More than 100 tourists spent night at altitude on Mount Teide in Tenerife after 250 were trapped in two cable cars Helicopters arrive to help rescue the tourists on the volcano. Photograph: Ramón de la Rocha/EPA View more sharing options   12.28 GMT Last modified on   12.41 GMT 
Three helicopters have assisted more than 100 tourists who spent the night at high altitude after they were rescued from a malfunctioning cable car in Spain’s Canary Islands. Spanish firemen rescue passengers from a cable car. Photograph: Ramón de la Rocha/EPA 
Most tourists had been airlifted by midday on Thursday while a small group was walking down from the Teide volcano on Tenerife accompanied by rescue workers, said Lourdes Jorge, a spokeswoman with the regional emergency service. She said no injuries had been reported. 
The volcano’s cable car operator said that a security lock had been triggered automatically for unknown reasons on Wednesday, leaving more than 250 people trapped in two cabins. 
More than half of them were evacuated by the end of Wednesday, but 111 in the higher cabin were accommodated for the night in facilities over 3,500 metres above sea level. Topics
